title: Possible Updated Map of Runeterra
body:
I was wondering if we would ever get a Updated/Official map of Runeterra. We get snippets and cut outs and small maps of certain areas but we have yet to get a map of the Northern Continent of "Valoran"  and Southern Continent (yet to be named). 

I wanna know where Targon is, how far Noxus is from Demacia. The secret entrances to Bandle City or where Ionia sits and how to get the Shadow Isles. I also wanna make a Minecraft map of Runterra.... (please no judgement). Are we ever gonna get one? Riot? As someone who loves the lore and world of League, this would make my life.

replies.body:
So, the current philosophy is that we likely won't release a complete, objectively truthful, world map in the foreseeable future because it ties our hands too firmly and too quickly.  

What we _are_ doing (as you've seen with the map snippets and cut outs as you mention) is creating maps that could exist in the universe of Runeterra.  Maps made by people (or entities, or magic) with agendas, incomplete information, biases and goals.

That's why a map from a Piltover trade clan head can go into somewhat reliable detail on the coastlines and cities that he trades with, but should not be relied upon for information on troop distributions, mountain ranges, or the migration patterns of certain magical beasties.  Heck, the creator of the Medarda Heirloom map is so _prejudiced_ that he doesn't even label Zaun - in his opinion, it's out of sight; out of mind.

Future maps (and there will be future maps) will show other angles.  Maybe we do get a map showing magical migration patterns, or we find the map of a nation trying to legitimize its claims on certain lands, or a capricious and fickle map of how to get to Bandle City.

The plan, being, that with each map revealed, a new way of looking at Runeterra and its peoples is shown.  Smart cartographers like yourself can, of course, read between the lines and interpolate a colder, more scientific, interpretation of landmasses and seas, and in my heart I believe that one day the sheer weight of accumulated maps will mean that an atlas-style map will come due.

With that in mind, until the day an atlas might arrive - what sort of cultural artifact maps would you like to see?  (I am full of ideas and plans for the next one, but open to suggestions for the one after that.)
That 3D map from Treasure Planet is really cool also if you have seen it, the dragon eye from How to Train Your Dragon the show

> [{quoted}](name=Spideraxe,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=10xoTGxJ,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2017-04-09T15:35:29.813+0000)
>
> That 3D map from Treasure Planet is really cool also if you have seen it, the dragon eye from How to Train Your Dragon the show

I've not seen the one from the How to Train Your Dragon show, and I can't find a video of it, but from screenshots and descriptions it sounds like a projector that you breathe dragon fire into to power?  And I loved the one from Treasure Planet (link [here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sTa-8RzsAbg) for the unaware).

While those are nifty ways to show a map (projection in both cases - 2d vs 3d) who would those maps be created by, and for, and what would be their purpose?  In the Treasure Planet film, its a treasure map through space - but while it looks really cool it isn't very pirate-y in form once you solve the puzzle ball.  In How to Train Your Dragon, it functions as map and dragon encyclopedia - used by ancient peoples to keep secret dragon information (and its form is pretty good for that, even if it feels a bit like a plot crutch ;)

As an example - if the Treasure Planet map was made by Aurelion Sol, then I imagine that map would be _very_ different from a galactic map created by the Targonians.  His relationship with the stars is one of love and unfathomable affection - unlike the Targonians.  

Maps aren't just 'what', and they're often not even just 'where' - they're 'who' too.

I thought the Project promo already gave that treasure planet map vibe; I like how it builds every release too as if we got another key.

I would like to see a landmark based map maybe from the Freljord inhabitants 
(seems like the best fit).

The maps we have are 'carry with you' maps rather than 'there when you need them' maps.
A 3D map summoned by a wizard would be neat. Magical wispy scouts mapping out a fortress or some ancient ruins, [like they do with drones in Prometheus](https://vimeo.com/127434715).

Thanks for taking the time to actually look up the Dragon Eye despite never having see the show, personally if i were to apply something like that to Runeterra and not have it be based on dragon fire, since that'd be cheating, I would say maybe it could powered by like light refractions through a black ice lense by the watchers and a treasure planet ball could maybe an extension of the projector if used in like a dome with like more crystals. I just really the concept of map projectors

An architectural map would be neat; a map stolen to make a heist in Noxus Prime, for example. Could show some architectural ideas there too!

The general blueprint of the city Shurima could probably be mapped pretty elegantly; I imagine it's design would be pretty precisely planned around "sacred geometries" and stuff as opposed to the organic, chaotic growth of urban Zaun.

Of course, there are a million places one'd want to see on a map; I think players will hungrily gobble up a map of anywhere!

So this isn't a fully fleshed idea cause I literally just had it but here goes, what if we saw a map from the perspective of someone like Ivern (who I realize probably has no need for a map *queue Ezreal joke*), so instead of a map that cares about cities and the goings on of people, it'd talk about how this wildflowers blooms nicely in this region, or how the poros are really found of this path through the mountains, etc... Sorta like if the animals all got together and made a map, what would they care about? And sure it still may hint at civilizations in so much as magical creatures would find Demacia off-putting or they may mention a particular mustachioed man up in the freljord who has the warmest of hearts and gives out tasty snacks. Now again not really sure why such a map would be made, be it from Ivern, Yordles, Vastayans, etc... but I think this would be really cool to see.
